title: Camden Lock slab serif architectural lettering
content:
Hi,

Anyone can help me identify the “CAMDEN LOCK” typeface? It is not Lubalin Graph, Glypha, Rockwell.

Thanks!  
Ben.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021221208im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_0704_4735.jpg)
author: benleb

comments.content: It's something like Stymie Black, but the join in the **K** is more like Clarendon, and somebody had a little fun with the serifs on **E** and **L**.

\> _Anyone can help me identify the “CAMDEN LOCK” typeface?_

Well, you have to realise that this is architectural lettering, not type. There will be no exact equivalent in digital typography, maybe near matches.

Though it seems it's based on a Logo or the other way round:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021221208im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_5770.gif)

---  
FlxB

Oh, I didn't know that.

Well, logos are often custom designed or tweaked. But I could be wrong; maybe somebody knows what this typeface is.

Thanks for your help.

Did some more research and It does seem to be a logo based on a font like Rockwell, Geometric SlabSerif or some other you've mentioned.

Ben.
